meanings.sent1: The zoo had many rhesuses in their primate exhibit.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study rhesuses to learn more about primates.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rhesuses stole the visitors' snacks at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: In the jungle, the rhesuses ruled the treetops with agility.
meanings.sent5: The baby rhesus clung tightly to its mother's back as they swung through the trees.

meanings.definition: Rhesuses: belonging to the genus Macaca
meanings.sent1: The rhesuses in the research lab were part of the Macaca genus.
meanings.sent2: Zoos often have rhesuses as part of their primate collection.
meanings.sent3: The rhesuses in the sanctuary enjoyed grooming each other in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The rhesuses' playful antics reminded the researchers of their close relation to humans.
meanings.sent5: The rhesuses' distinctive calls echoed through the forest, marking their territory.
